main event: Several elliptical-shaped white objects were observed over Greenville Air Force Base, South Carolina on 19 April 1948. They were sighted by credible witnesses from the 5th Liaison Squadron and appeared to be hovering, then rapidly accelerating and climbing northward.
interesting points: The objects were observed by credible witnesses from the 5th Liaison Squadron at Greenville Air Force Base, South Carolina.
Witnesses heard the sound of fighter aircraft in the vicinity, which initially drew their attention to the sky and led to the sighting of the unidentified objects.
The objects were initially mistaken for weather balloons, but their rapid acceleration and unusual behavior led the witnesses to reconsider their initial assessment.
No sound or exhaust trails were reported from the objects, and the weather conditions at the time were reported as 'ceiling and visibility unlimited (CAVU).'
The observation lasted for approximately two minutes, during which the objects were stationary for about one minute before rapidly accelerating and moving out of sight.
location: Greenville Air Force Base, South Carolina
witnesses: Credible witnesses from the 5th Liaison Squadron
